current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide financial assistance for school construction
		  after a violent or traumatic crisis.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Helping Communities Rebuild After
			 Deadly School Shootings and Other Traumatic Events
			 Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 4121 of the Elementary and Secondary
			 Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:9
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:10
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:8
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:8
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the
				provision of financial assistance (not to exceed 50 percent of the total cost
				specified in the application) for a local educational agency that has an
				application approved by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4154/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and serves a school in which the learning
				environment has been disrupted due to a violent or traumatic crisis that took
				place on the school campus, to enable such local educational agency to carry
				out—

text.#text:
the acquisition
				(by purchase, lease, donation, or otherwise) of an interest in improved or
				unimproved real property that the local educational agency deems necessary to
				commence or continue an appropriate learning environment in a public elementary
				or secondary school, as a result of damage incurred by a violent or traumatic
				crisis; and

the construction
				of new facilities, or the renovation, repair, or alteration of existing
				facilities, that the local educational agency deems necessary to commence or
				continue an appropriate learning environment in a public elementary or
				secondary school, as a result of damage incurred by a violent or traumatic
				crisis; and

by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:9
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4121/ss:a/p:9

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text:
to
				carry out the activities described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#tail:
. Funds
				made available to carry out
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
such sums as may be
				necessary for fiscal year 2014 and each of the 4 succeeding fiscal years

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There are authorized to be appropriated

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1025 IS: Helping Communities Rebuild After Deadly School Shootings and Other Traumatic Events Act
